ChartStyle
INotifyPropertyChanged
public
ChartSharp.​ChartStyle

Defines the rendering style of a LineChart.

Functions
ChartStyle
public ChartStyle()

Initializes all properties to their default values

Properties
DrawAxis
public bool DrawAxis { get; set }

If true, axis are drawn in the LineChart. If one or both AxisStyle members (XAxisStyle and YAxisStyle) are null, they are still not rendered. E.g. if XAxisStyle is defined, but YAxisStyle is null, only the X-Axis will be rendered.

Default Value

true

DrawGrid
public bool DrawGrid { get; set }

If true, a grid is drawn in the background of the LineChart. If GridStyle is null, it will still be not rendered.

Default Value

true

GridStyle
public GridStyle GridStyle { get; set }

The style of the grid of the LineChart. See ChartSharp.GridStyle.

Default Value

Constructor of ChartSharp.GridStyle

PaddingX
public double PaddingX { get; set }

The distance in pixels from the left and right side of the border of the chart itself that are left empty.

Default Value

30

PaddingY
public double PaddingY { get; set }

The distance in pixels from the top and bottom side of the border of the chart itself that are left empty.

Default Value

30

TitleColor
public Color TitleColor { get; set }

The color of the title (defined in LineChart).

Default Value

Colors.Black

TitleFontSize
public double TitleFontSize { get; set }

The size of the font of the title of the LineChart. An exception can occur if this value is 0 or smaller.

Default Value

24

XAxisStyle
public AxisStyle XAxisStyle { get; set }

The style of the X-Axis. See AxisStyle.

Default Value

Constructor of AxisStyle

YAxisStyle
public AxisStyle YAxisStyle { get; set }

The style of the Y-Axis. See AxisStyle.

Default Value

Constructor of AxisStyle
